001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Abstraction.TemporalState;
004
005/**
006 * Any data related to the state of the outbreak which is valid only in a
007 * specific time point. This list of things is shared between the
008 * {@link OutbreakState} and {@link OutbreakHistory} and will be automatically
009 * copied across by the {@link HistoryMapper}. Generally these things are only
010 * implemented in {@link OutbreakState} and the temporal version is just a copy
011 * of the data. As such they have to be things that don't change retrospectively
012 * and you won't find observed values here, which depend on the output of
013 * testing and hence tend to be in {@link OutbreakHistory}.
014 */
015public interface OutbreakTemporalState
016                extends TemporalState<Outbreak>, Cloneable {
017
018        /**
019         * This derived value is the number of people requiring hospitalisation at a
020         * given point in time.
021         *
022         * @return Count of people newly requiring hospitalisation at any given time
023         *         point. This would be equivalent to hospital admission incidence.
024         */
025        long getAdmissionIncidence();
026
027        /**
028         * This derived value is the cumulative number of people who have required
029         * hospitalisation since the start of the outbreak.
030         *
031         * A true value:<br>
032         * <br>
033         *
034         * @return the cumulative number of people who have required hospitalisation
035         *         since the start of the outbreak.
036         */
037        long getCumulativeAdmissions();
038
039        /**
040         * Cumulative average absolute loss of compliance compared to baseline.
041         *
042         * A true value:<br>
043         *
044         * @return per person average of the cumulative absolute compliance decrease
045         *         compared to baseline. This is the sum of the total compliance
046         *         decrease for the current state and the cumulative compliance
047         *         decrease from the history. It represents the overall decrease in
048         *         compliance compared to baseline over the course of the outbreak,
049         *         and is a measure of the impact of restrictions and/or disease on
050         *         compliance.
051         */
052        double getCumulativeComplianceDecrease();
053
054        /**
055         * Cumulative infections is the total number of infections that have occurred
056         * since the start of the outbreak. This is a key metric for understanding
057         * the overall scale of the outbreak and is used in various places such as to
058         * determine how many people are immune and to inform policy decisions.
059         *
060         * <br>
061         * A true value
062         *
063         * @return the total number of infections that have occurred since the start
064         *         of the outbreak.
065         */
066        long getCumulativeInfections();
067
068        /**
069         * Cumulative average absolute loss of mobility compared to baseline.
070         *
071         * A true value:<br>
072         *
073         * @return per person average of the cumulative absolute mobility decrease
074         *         compared to baseline. This is the sum of the total mobility
075         *         decrease for the current state and the cumulative mobility
076         *         decrease from the history. It represents the overall decrease in
077         *         mobility compared to baseline over the course of the outbreak, and
078         *         is a measure of the impact of restrictions and/or disease.
079         */
080        double getCumulativeMobilityDecrease();
081
082        /**
083         * A true value:
084         *
085         * @return count of people in hospital at any given time point. This would be
086         *         equivalent to hospital occupancy.
087         */
088        long getHospitalisedCount();
089
090        /**
091         * A true value:
092         *
093         * @return the number of newly infected people today
094         */
095        long getIncidence();
096
097        /**
098         * A true value:
099         *
100         * @return the number of infected people today (a prevalence)
101         */
102        long getInfectedCount();
103
104        /**
105         * This derived value is the maximum number of people who have required
106         * hospitalisation at any given point in time since the start of the
107         * outbreak.
108         *
109         * A true value:<br>
110         * <br>
111         *
112         * @return the maximum number of people who have required hospitalisation at
113         *         any given point in time since the start of the outbreak.
114         */
115        long getMaximumHospitalBurden();
116
117        /**
118         * Maximum incidence is the highest number of new infections that have
119         * occurred in a single day since the start of the outbreak. This is a key
120         * metric for understanding the peak of the outbreak and is used in various
121         * places such as to determine healthcare capacity needs and to inform policy
122         * decisions.
123         *
124         * <br>
125         * A true value:
126         *
127         * @return the highest number of new infections that have occurred in a
128         *         single day since the start of the outbreak.
129         */
130        long getMaximumIncidence();
131
132        /**
133         * A true value:
134         *
135         * @return the maximum prevalence in the outbreak so far.
136         */
137        double getMaximumPrevalence();
138
139        /**
140         * This derived value is the number of people who are currently infected at a
141         * given point in time versus all the non dead people. This is a key metric
142         * for understanding the overall scale of the outbreak and is used in various
143         * places such as to determine how many people are immune and to inform
144         * policy decisions.
145         *
146         * @return the number of people who are currently infected at a given point
147         *         in time versus all the non dead people.
148         */
149        double getPrevalence();
150
151        /**
152         * Time to maximum incidence is the time it takes for the outbreak to reach
153         * its peak incidence. This is a key metric for understanding the speed of
154         * the outbreak and is used in various places such as to determine the timing
155         * of interventions and to inform policy decisions.
156         *
157         * A true value:<br>
158         * <br>
159         *
160         * @return the time it takes for the outbreak to reach its peak incidence.
161         */
162        long getTimeToMaximumIncidence();
163}
